stimulusHtml: By the <u>late nineteenth century</u>, artists’ self-portraits would increasingly emphasize which of the following?

features.html:
Refer to the image below.

Albrecht Dürer, Self-Portrait, 1500

Bridgeman Images

The inscription reads: “I, Albrecht Dürer of Nuremberg painted myself thus, with undying colors, in my twenty-eighth year.”

choicesHtml: Realist themes, which drew the audience’s attention to the suffering of the working class
Exotic themes, which reflected Europe’s increased interaction with foreign cultures
Positivist themes, which emphasized the improvement and perfectibility of humankind
Subjective themes, which emphasized the portrayal of the artist’s inner emotional state
